Author: DutchTranslator
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: This is one of the problems OEL Foundation is tackling:  ''In many markets, a large percentage of logistics for road transport is handled by brokers known as ‚Äú3PLs‚Äù (third party logistics providers, sub-contracting services) or ‚Äú4PLs‚Äù(fourth parties used to manage 3PLs). When a truckload of toiletries arrives in an Indonesian town, for example, that shipment has already gone through three or even four iterations of handling by sub-contractors. The person performing the actual delivery to the consignee at the end of the supply chain could be the owner or operator of an individual van or truck. These transporters typically do not have IT systems for recording data on their shipment and rely on manual processes.  The result is that transfers are made through a fragmented base of outsourced transportation providers without real-time tracking, limiting the visibility of shipment events for the shipper.''

Author: gorogoronomi
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: Alliance members are involved in the conceptualisation, development, and implementation of blockchain applications using the OEL Enterprise Architecture, with the goal of making blockchain applications real and actionable for stakeholders.  The three tiers of membership in the OEL Foundation Alliance are:  General Members have access to the information produced by the Foundation, and to production ready applications.  Premium Members have quarterly access to the development team, along with access to software development kits (SDKs) and beta releases for early stage blockchain applications.  Enterprise Council Members influence the direction of development of the Enterprise Architecture, and can co-author articles, studies, and other content released by the Foundation. They receive the same full technology access as Premium members.  XVC Logistics, BSA Logistics and Maia Global are all premium members of OEL Foundation Alliance.

Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: What will you be able to do with OPN tokens?  The OPN Token is the utility token powering the OEL Protocol through four key utility functions:  1.    Smart contract validation 2.    Micro-rewards and incentivisation 3.    Point of Access 4.    Staking   So in the future after you've purchased OPN tokens, you will be able to use them to stake on the platform and earn rewards!

Author: gorogoronomi
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: Consider the socioeconomic impact of OEL's vision on logistics:  Most trucks are empty on the way back, by encouraging drivers to share information on their available capacity we can drive Backhaul optimization = more efficient usage of trucks = lower costs to shippers, more revenues to transporters and less trucks on our roads for the same volumes transported -> less pollution, less traffic.  Also, with blockchain tech, we can now truly make CSR audit on road transport activities of large companies (we know which type of trucks moved which good from point A to point B). This level of granular data for each shipments did not exist before. Security impact, truck drivers are most of the time sleep deprived and try to cut down on breaks to finish their delivery as fast as possible (they drive all night). With micro intensitives and smart contracts we can incentives drivers to take breaks every few hours, improving security for the driver and reducing risk for the shipper.  This is just a few examples...

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: Reducing reliance is one of the benefits of the OEL ecosystem. OpenPort has established this already back in May when a blockchain-enabled invoice factoring transaction was completed.  OpenPort used its blockchain to confirm the delivery of a shipment and issue an invoice. All of this was verified without the interacting with the seller‚Äôs payor and was bought fast at a lower rate. This is a good example of providing cheap and fast transport financial backing using the blockchain.

Author: MarkZNZ
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: Road transportation forms the core of all logistics movements. It is a USD 2 trillion-dollar industry globally in 2017; Involving hundreds of thousands of movements daily ‚Äì across different legs of supply chain. It involves multiple stakeholders ‚Äì primary ones being shipper, transporter, driver and consignee. Supported by intermediaries, viz. logistics service providers; banks; custom brokers; technology solution providers; government agencies and regulatory bodies.  Many elements of this process have been automated. eg: Transport Management Systems integrated with ERPs; technology solutions for last mile delivery - typically used by online retailers.  However, lack of secure supply chain control in the distribution channel, particularly in less developed markets, tend to drive up distribution costs due to lost sales, penalties from late delivery, theft or pilferage, and product damage.  With multiple parties are involved in data chain ‚Äì starting with delivery note from shipper or logistics service provider; commercial and tax invoice from shipper; and finally, delivery confirmation from consignee; to highlight few critical data reconciliation points. One of the greatest business problem of road transportation industry is delivery confirmation or Proof of Delivery (POD); which is prone to being inaccurate and unreliable.  This is ONE of the problems which OEL foundation is endeavouring to solve by building an open protocol for enterprise logistics applications.

Author: GreenSkyTrails
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: If you've got any doubts on the level of complex benchmarks and metrics the OEL Foundation's blockchain can track, rest easy because here are some of them:  Perfect Order Measurement Cash to Cash Cycle Time Customer Order Cycle Time Fill Rate Supply Chain Cycle Time Inventory Days of Supply Freight bill accuracy Freight cost per unit Inventory Turnover Days Sales Outstanding Average Payment Period for Production Materials On Time Shipping Rate Inventory Turnover Ratio (ITR) Turn-Earn Index (TEI) Gross Margin Return on Investment (GMROI) Days of Supply (DOS) Inventory Velocity (IV)  OEL's enterprise architecture is going to be the most feature packed supply chain blockchain in the market

Author: DutchTranslator
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: ''The TGE Phase 1 shall be comprised of a private purchaser pre-sale and a public purchaser main sale. Upon implementation of the OEL Foundation main net, TGE Phase 2 will take place as a public sale in 2019. This sale will comprise an issuance of new tokens at the then prevailing market price and, if relevant, an issuance of replacement OPN Tokens for holders of ERC20-compliant OPN Tokens.''  Source: https://oel.foundation/token-generation-event/  So the answer is no, seeing as how there might be a replacement of tokens for token holders.

Author: oa17
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: The blockchain ecosystem is fragmented. The supply chain is fragmented. Instead of multitudes of entities duplicating efforts in silos, an alliance is needed to collectively solve shared objectives. In order to fully harness the massive and disruptive benefits of blockchain on the supply chain, a focused community must reach in a single direction. Momentum, applications and results are easier won through collaboration, especially in distributed ledger technology and the complex logistics powering global commerce. This is the intent and purpose behind the creation of the OEL Alliance and OEL Enterprise Architecture.  Read more: https://medium.com/oel-foundation/join-the-alliance-89577be713fa

Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: Greetings folks!  To reward our loyal supporters, we are proud to announce the launch of OEL Foundation Ambassadors Program, hosted by our community management partners AmaZix.  The OEL Foundation Ambassadors Program will enable the most active members of our community to receive a higher bonus during the public presale of the OPN Token Generation Event (TGE).  Read more about it: https://medium.com/oel-foundation/become-an-oel-foundation-ambassador-and-earn-a-tge-bonus-9eed73e85ea

Author: gorogoronomi
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: We are delighted to share some great news with you today. Roger Crook, the former CEO of DHL Global Forwarding and the current CEO of Capital Springboard, has joined the Foundation as a Board Member. Roger is one of the most recognisable figures in the supply chain industry, and a successful ICO advisor. Having him as a full board member is a great vote of confidence in the future of the Foundation.  Read the full announcement on Medium:  https://medium.com/oel-foundation/welcoming-roger-crook-of-capital-springboard-to-the-board-of-directors-825a142f84fb

Author: GreenSkyTrails
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: Why OEL? Here's one reason:  Lack of secure supply chain control in the distribution channel, particularly in less developed markets, can drive up distribution costs due to lost sales, penalties from late delivery, theft or pilferage, and product damage. Often, a full one percent of top-line revenue is lost due to inabilities to invoice caused by disputed, undelivered, or lost shipments.

Author: GreenSkyTrails
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: Check out this article by OEL Foundation CTO Mark Nelson, where he discusses the best practices in designing a proper blockchain-based enterprise architecture!  If you're ever in that position, this article might be useful in giving you some pointers on how to approach analysis and design work for your own enterprise architecture.  https://medium.com/oel-foundation/best-practices-in-designing-a-blockchain-based-enterprise-architecture-c102fe907ba0

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: OEL Foundation‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäUnified Logistics Blockchain Infrastructure  The Open Enterprise Logistics Foundation (OEL) is a non-profit organization that provides management and resources for the development of the OEL blockchain ecosystem. The OEL ecosystem includes OEL Enterprise‚Äôs open source architecture, OPN Token and members of the OEL Alliance.  The creation of a unified infrastructure based on blockchain technology has a number of advantages that you can hardly argue with. Just imagine the scalability and high speed of transactions, which, in this case, once and for all, will save businesses from paperwork, confusion and data loss.  The second important aspect is the confidentiality of data. For the corporate environment, this is simply the most important factor that the existing centralized solutions can not adequately represent.  Read more: https://medium.com/@Vladar49/oel-foundation-unified-logistics-blockchain-infrastructure-ee3cfa18cbdf

Author: GreenSkyTrails
Title: [ANN] OEL Foundation - Open Enterprise Logistics Enterprise Architecture
Body: By the way, if you didn't know The Open Enterprise Logistics (OEL) Foundation estimates that the current outsourced spend on domestic road freight in Asia alone is over USD 143 billion per year, to service USD 6 trillion in retail goods transfers (PwC, 2016) (transport costs are typically 3% of freight value).  OEL's solution will cut costs and can save the industry billions of dollars due to removing inefficiencies!
